intro: Galium nuttallii subsp. nuttallii, commonly known as Nuttall's bedstraw, is a flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its slender stems and opposite leaves that are usually hairy. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its berries are small, dark, and often persist into the fall, contributing to its ecological role in supporting wildlife.
